conclusion: Determine the average velocity and average speed of the particle.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1m.
The length of one semi-circular arc is πr.
The particle starts at point A and ends at point C.
The total displacement is the diameter of the circle, which is 2m.
Average velocity is defined as the total displacement divided by the total time.
Average speed is defined as the total distance traveled divided by the total time.
The average velocity is 0.4 m/s and the average speed is 2π/5 m/s.
